Key Match Events: The match ended in a goalless draw after 120 minutes.
Chris Mepham was sent off in added time of extra time for a second yellow card.
Post-Match Reflections: Rob Page shared his thoughts after Wales' defeat to Poland in penalties to end their hopes of qualifying for the Euro 2024.
Michal Probierz, Poland's manager, reflected on the team's qualification for the Euro 2024.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This marked Wales' first Euro 2024 qualification failure since 2012.
Ben Davies had a header disallowed by VAR for offside in the first half.
Others: Poland will be in Group D with France, Netherlands, and Austria at the Euro 2024 finals in Germany.
The game was played at the Cardiff City Stadium with an attendance of 31,876.
